edu.cuny.ai.learning
Class RothErevLearner

java.lang.Object
  edu.cuny.ai.learning.AbstractLearner
      edu.cuny.ai.learning.RothErevLearner
All Implemented Interfaces:
DiscreteLearner, Learner, StimuliResponseLearner, Parameterizable, Prototypeable, Resetable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NPTRothErevLearner
public class RothErevLearner
extends AbstractLearner
implements Prototypeable, StimuliResponseLearner, java.io.Serializable

A class implementing the Roth-Erev learning algorithm. This learning algorithm is designed to mimic human-like behaviour in extensive form games. See:

A.E.Roth and I. Erev "Learning in extensive form games: experimental data and simple dynamic models in the intermediate term" Games and Economic Behiour, Volume 8

Parameters

base.k
int >= 0		 (the number of a possible actions)
base.recency
double [0,1]		 (the recency parameter)
base.experimentation
double [0,1]		 (the experimentation parameter)
base.scaling
int >= 0		 (the scaling parameter)

Default Base

rotherev_learner

Version:
$Revision: 1.18 $
Author:
Steve Phelps

getLearningDelta

public double getLearningDelta()
Description copied from interface: Learner
Return a value indicative of the amount of learning that occured during the last iteration. Values close to 0.0 indicate that the learner has converged to an equilibrium status.

Specified by:
getLearningDelta in interface Learner
Specified by:
